thread.title_full: Sole survivor of World War II massacre on Banka Island | Daily Mail Online

author: Ashleigh Davis For Daily Mail Australia
title: Sole survivor of World War II massacre on Banka Island | Daily Mail Online
text: Incredible story of Australian nurse who was shot in the hip and played dead in the water to survive a Second World War massacre of 21 people on an Indonesian island Sister Vivian Bullwinkel was the only survivor in the Banka Island massacre One civilian and 20 nurses were shot off Radji Beach on February 16, 1942 Sister Bullwinkel was shot but lay facedown in the water pretending to be dead She hid with a wounded British soldier for 12 days before surrendering and spent the next three-and-a-half years as a POW in the Palemburg camp in Sumatra After the war she became the president of the Australian College of Nursing She received the Florence Nightingale medal, an MBE and AM for her service Published: 03:40 GMT, 17 February 2017 | Updated: 07:38 GMT, 17 February 2017 122 shares
